results.title: Maine harbour town
results.creator_credit: John A. Haeseler, Louis de Rochemont Associates and United World Films
results.brief_description: An impression of life in a coastal community of New England, USA. In this region where the soil is poor and stony and the growing season short, the people turn to various occupations to supplement their income. The Kellors who live in Camden, Maine, are a typical New England family. They earn what they can from their farm and dairy herd, but find it necessary to add to their income by working in the factories and mills, by fishing, and by accepting tourists into their home as paying guests.

results.title: Maimed artist
results.creator_credit: Nicholas C Gorski and Gonzo Media Group
results.brief_description: This interesting program gives background information to a news story that was run in San Francisco about an artist who maimed himself while pursuing his art. Three artists use shock tactics to get people interested in their performance art. They specifically use machines they have modified or built and fire as part of their art. While working on a piece of art Mark Pauline blew most of his left hand off.

results.title: Mail Order Bride (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Stephen Wallace, Michael Carson and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Kevin Saunders, a builder in the small country town of Badigeri, decides to import a Filipino bride, but in doing so he also imports a few problems. At first it seems as if his marriage to the pretty Ampy has potential, but the local townsfolk are both racist and sexist and Ampy, struggling to find her place in the town, finds difficulty in dealing with the conflicting pressures. Starring Ray Meagher and Charito Ortez.

results.title: Mail early for Xmas
results.brief_description: In this pre-Christmas reminder to mail early, filmmaker Norman McLaren used an electric vibra-drill to engrave the images on black film, and included the occasional “subliminal” burst of lettering, which he hand-scratched on a few frames.

results.title: Mail early
results.brief_description: Norman McLaren’s first film for the NFB was this publicity clip for Canada Post. Non-abstract symbols drawn with pen on clear 35 mm stock were superimposed on a photographed painted background. Benny Goodman’s rendition of Jingle Bells provided the sound.

results.title: Maids and madams
results.brief_description: Over a million black women live in a state of domestic bondage, underpaid, working long hours, at the mercy of draconian laws which separate them from their own families. This powerful documentary, shot in South Africa, examines the tragedy of Apartheid through the complex relationship between a black household worker and her white employer. This domestic situation is a microcosm of the situation at large.

results.title: Mahratta: an experience shared
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday, Australian Instructional Films and Bank of New South Wales
results.brief_description: The Mahratta Senior Staff College of the Bank of New South Wales which was established in 1817 with a staff of two, now provides training facilities for large numbers of employees including the Senior Staff College, Mahratta. Potential executives and managers attend an intensive course of lectures, discussions, study and report writing. The facilities of the college building and extracts from lectures, discussions and the lighter side of college life are shown.

results.title: Mahatma Gandhi
results.brief_description: Photographs and newsreel shots are used in documenting the highlights of the life of Mohandas Gandhi, India’s political and spiritual leader. Traces Gandhi’s efforts to gain freedom for his people - the “homespun” program which stimulated production; the march to the sea in 1930 to protest against oppressive British excise taxes on salt; the movements to free the ostracised untouchables and to give women political equality. Discusses the effectiveness of Gandhi’s philosophy of non-violent resistance.

results.title: Mahalia
results.creator_credit: Allen H Miner, Richard St Johns, Graham Lee Mahin, Marconlee and Roha Enterprises
results.brief_description: This documentary is a portrait of one of the world’s finest gospel singers, a warm and sincere woman with strong religious faith and an unquestioning belief in humanity, the wonderful Miss Mahalia Jackson. Filmed on location in London, Stockholm, Berlin and many other European cities during her inspirational European tour, Mahalia finds time between performances to talk about her background, her lifetime passion for spreading the gospel beyond the church through concert appearances and album recordings, and her commitment to championing the causes of justice, freedom and peace in the world. It was shortly after this triumphant tour that Mahalia Jackson passed away (1972). However her legacy lives on. Songs in this film include “Didn’t it rain”, “He’s got the whole world in his hands”, “Just a closer walk with thee”, “We shall overcome” and many other favourites. Narrated by Brock Peters.
